item.title: Creating a playground for GPT-3 in emacs
item.description: Code https://github.com/mullikine/pen.el Prompts https://github.com/mullikine/prompts meetup.com event https://www.meetup.com/Code-Craft-Dunedin/events/276407816/ Slides http://github.com/mullikine/presentation-prompt-engineering-in-emacs/blob/master/presentation.pdf Demonstration Prompt-Engineering Part 1: Building an environment Summary of talk I got a key for the OpenAI API just a couple of days before my birthday.

item.title: Generating Talking Head Models From Text With Synced Voice
item.description: In this report I introduce a pipeline to animate a chatbot.

item.title: Anya
item.description: Connected end to end with GPT-2 chatbot.

item.title: Dr Will from Transcendence
item.description: This is a demonstration of Text to Speech, speech to landmarks, then landmarks to animation.

item.title: Elon Musk
item.description: We can retrain to fit a particular voice quite well.

item.title: Joi from Blade Runner 2049
item.description: Almost real time generation of speech to talking head.

item.title: Generating poetry with GPT-2
item.description: I use OpenAI’s GPT-2 to generate poetry. The model takes a string as inspiration which consists firstly of a lengthy poem to set the task/style and a phrase concatenated to the end which sets the topic.
